PPLoc: EMEA Employee Handbook; please see also link below
activities: Sonus Networks, Inc. (“Sonus”) is the US-based public parent company of companies in several locations around the world, including the European Union (“EU”). Due to the global nature of Sonus’s business, transfers of employee Personally Identifiable Information across national boundaries may occur.
eucountries: Czech Republic, France, Germany, Italy, Netherlands, Spain, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Off-line and on-line human resources data
recoursemech: Sonus uses internal processes to conduct self-assessments to ensure that this policy complies with the Safe Harbor Principles. To report a complaint about Sonus’s processing of PII, the employee may first contact the Safe Harbor Contact. Sonus will try in good faith to resolve the complaint. If the complaint is not resolved through internal processes, the employee may report the complaint to the to the applicable EU Data Protection Authority. By voluntarily certifying that it will comply with the Safe Harbor Principles, Sonus has made itself subject to the dispute resolution enforcement and sanctioning powers of the Federal Trade Commission and has agreed to cooperate and comply with the applicable Data Protection Authorities.
